page.title: 14Housing in Ingleton
page.content: Bank Hall is in the main street next to Curlew Crafts, once that was one house owned by the Greenwoods.The house has small windows and a stained glass door, green window panes and a brown pebble dashed front.Bank hall doesn't have a cellar it has a loft but it is used as an insulation loft. The house has a green iron doorway which is Elizabethan.There are green window frames and a date that says 1765.The house was split up in the 1800,s and recently became Curlew Crafts.The grandma of one of the boys in our group owns Bank Hall but before that the Greenwoods used to live there generation after generation. The dampness of the walls is reasonable considering how old the house is but the walls are very thick.
